com.ace.lewissketch
Class Bond

java.lang.Object
  com.ace.lewissketch.Bond
All Implemented Interfaces:
LsConstants
 class Bond
extends Object
implements LsConstants

Describes a bond of a Lewis structure.

myClone

Bond myClone(Atom a1,
             Atom a2)
Copy constructor. Since the atoms are references into the atom list, they must be given and not actually CLONED!

Parameters:
a1 - atom 1 of the bond
a2 - atom 2 of the bond
Returns:
the copied bond

setAtoms

void setAtoms(Atom bondAtom1,
              Atom bondAtom2)
Given 2 preexisting atoms, make them the 2 atoms of this bond. Calculate new endpoints of double/triple lines and bounding box.

Parameters:
bondAtom1 - atom 1 of the bond
bondAtom2 - atom 2 of the bond

void swapAtoms()
Swaps the two atoms of this bond, and calculates new endpoints of double/triple lines and bounding box.

setStrength

void setStrength(int s)
Set strength of bond, validating between 1 and 3, and sets stereo to none if new strength is not 1.

Parameters:
s - the new strength

hasAtoms

boolean hasAtoms(Atom candidateAtom1,
                 Atom candidateAtom2)
Determines if two atoms are the two atoms involved with this bond, based on the key of the atoms.

Parameters:
candidateAtom1 - atom 1 of the bond
candidateAtom2 - atom 2 of the bond
Returns:
true if the two atoms make up the bond

hasAtom

Atom hasAtom(Atom candidateAtom)
Determines if this bond has the atom based on unique key. If so, returns reference to the "other" atom of the bond.

Parameters:
candidateAtom - an atom of the bond
Returns:
the other atom of this bond; null if the first atom is not aprt of this bond

calcEndPoints

void calcEndPoints()
Calculates the endpoints of the lines drawn for single, double and triple bond, along with the coordinates of the bounding box for "turf" testing.

Calculates the end points of a bond that is sloping.

Parameters:
coordsDiff - difference in coordinates of the two endpoints

betweenParallelLines

boolean betweenParallelLines(int[] line1point1,
                             int[] line1point2,
                             int[] line2point1,
                             int[] candidatePoint)
Finds whether a point lies between two parallel lines.

Parameters:
line1point1 - first point of a line
line1point2 - second point of a line
line2point1 - point of a line parallel to the first
candidatePoint - a candidate point
Returns:
true when the candidate lies between the parallel lines

candidatePoint - a candidate point
Returns:
